meanings.definition: To direct one's attention or efforts towards a particular object or activity.
meanings.sent1: She was focussing on finishing her homework before dinner.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys focussing on painting beautiful landscapes.
meanings.sent3: The cat was focussing intently on catching the elusive red dot.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a camera, constantly focussing on new ideas.
meanings.sent5: Focussing on the task at hand helped her achieve great results.

meanings.definition: To adjust the focus of a lens or optical instrument.
meanings.sent1: The photographer was focussing the camera to capture the perfect shot.
meanings.sent2: He spent hours focussing the telescope to observe the stars clearly.
meanings.sent3: Focussing the binoculars, he finally spotted the rare bird in the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her attention was like a lens, constantly focussing on the smallest details.
meanings.sent5: Focussing the microscope revealed a hidden world of tiny organisms.

meanings.definition: The act of bringing something into focus.
meanings.sent1: The focussing of the camera lens made the image sharp and clear.
meanings.sent2: She appreciated the focussing of the projector during the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy interrupted the focussing of the audience on the speaker.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's words acted as a focussing lens, guiding the students' attention.
meanings.sent5: The focussing of the spotlight highlighted the lead singer on stage.
